title: Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion in PSC

elements.name: SURVEY_INSTRUCTIONS
elements.html:
Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion in PSC

Purpose: PSC Partners mission is to drive research to identify treatments and a cure for PSC while providing education and support for those impacted by this rare disease. PSC affects patients of all backgrounds. The impact of the disease and barriers of care in a diverse population are not well known. Your participation in this survey helps researchers identify potential barriers of care and understand how characteristics like age, race, ethnicity, disability, gender, and sexual orientation may affect an individual's PSC experience, including reactions to medications. Promoting the inclusion of diverse patients in PSC research and clinical trials moves us towards discovering the right treatment for the right patient, which can benefit everyone with PSC.

Instructions: The survey will take you about 20 minutes to complete. It is important that you complete all the questions and that you also complete or update the Clinical Survey v3 at this time in order for the DEI data collection to be complete. Some necessary data will be collected from questions already implemented in the Clinical Survey v3, hence responses from the same point in time are needed. 

Your privacy is of the utmost importance. This survey has been approved by the Institutional Review Board (IRB) for the purpose of protecting patients' rights. As with all information provided within the Registry only de-identified data ever leaves the Registry. Please note that questions asking about sensitive information contain a "prefer to not respond" option.

This survey can be completed by a PSC patient or a caregiver on behalf of the PSC patient. In this survey, the PSC patient is referred to as the “participant.”
